message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.CYBER. 

The paper proposes a framework to identify social connections of a user who can satisfy their information needs on social media. The paper draws concepts from social foci theory and uses network and content information to infer soft community memberships of the asker and their social connections. The paper focuses on information seeking in social media, which falls under the categories of social media (cs.SOC), information retrieval (cs.IR), and computational linguistics (cs.CL). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of social context to identify answerers, which can be related to cybersecurity (cs.CYBER) and social influence (cs.SI).
